intro: Jatropha tubulosa, commonly known as the tubular jatropha, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America and is characterized by its distinctive tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and alternate leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with prominent stamen filaments that give it a striking appearance. Jatropha tubulosa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in sunny, arid environments.
